fif_core

Class DescriptionBasedFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • fif_core.Filter
      • fif_core.DescriptionBasedFilter

  • public class DescriptionBasedFilter
extends Filter
    This class provides the real implementation of a filter. This filter works on one single metadata and can filter resources.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Troiano Lorenzo

      • DescriptionBasedFilter

        public DescriptionBasedFilter(Metadata md)
        Builder that saves the metadata value.

        Preconditions:

        1-The metadata is not equal to null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The metadata is set correctly.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • doFilter

        public double doFilter(Resource r,
                       double value)
                throws InterpretationNotEqualException,
                       DescriptorWithNoValidMetadataException
        This method provides the real implementation of filtering.

        Preconditions:

        1-The resource is not equal to null.
        2-The value is between 0 and 1.

        3-Must exists an descriptor (associated to the resource in the ResourceRegister class) containing a metadata with the same attribute of the description based filter. 4-The metadata of the filter and the metadata (with the same attribute) of the descriptor associated to the resource must have the same interpretation. Postconditions:

        1-The filtering is done correctly returning a value between 0 and 1.

        Specified by:
        doFilter in class Filter
        Parameters:
        r - The resource you want to filter.
        value - The starting initial filtering value.
        Returns:
        The filter value between 0 and 1.
        Throws:
        InterpretationNotEqualException - when trying to matching two metadata with different interpretation.
        DescriptorWithNoValidMetadataException - when a descriptor hasn't a metadata with the specified attribute.

      • getMetadata

        public Metadata getMetadata()
        This method returns the current metadata of this filter.

        Postconditions:

        1-It's returned the metadata of this filter.

        Returns:
        The metadata of this filter.

      • setMetadata

        public void setMetadata(Metadata md)
        This method allows to set a metadata.

        Preconditions:

        1-The metadata is not equal to null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The metadata is set correctly.

        Parameters:
        md - The metadata you want to set in this filter.
